intro: Campanula patula var. pauciflora, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features upright, branching stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
